text: I'm Matt gross the frugal traveler for
the New York Times it's my job to roam
the world in search of cool hotels
luxurious meals and life-changing
experiences and to prove that comfort
doesn't have to cost a fortune it's not
just about how to travel it's about why
to travel
drive into the hills of northern New
Mexico and you'll find Santa Fe a pretty
little town of old adobe buildings 19th
century cathedrals and snippets of
history not only was I the frugal
traveler trying to survive the weekend
on $500 but I had a special guest my
mother who flown in from Connecticut to
join me it would be a challenge here in
a place where a tiny figurine like this
can cost 130 hand coil painted $20 think
about it know how much sure the big one
the big one you're looking at 1616 - oh
okay at least our hotel the camel Rock
Suites was a bargain $90.75 a night for
this beautiful quasi southwestern decor
and right in the main plaza we found an
affordable snack that's a classic treat
throughout the southwest the Frito pie
local legend has it that this concoction
was actually concocted right here back
in the 60s when this was still a
Woolworths her wait what is a Frito pie
okay I'm serving it up you sir in the
bag is it the Fritos that make it or is
it the chili something to Chile
me I'd say it's the combination of price
and weight just four dollars and 15
cents for feels like 3 pounds of chips
chili and cheese make that delicious

but it's also a gut bomb I had to work
it off somehow so I drove us into the
mountains to go ski
okay so it was the middle of summer and
there was no snow we went hiking instead
you don't realize how steep those bunny

high-speed quad to whisk you uphill but
hey the views were more than worth the
effort
too soon though I had to hurry back down
mom was waiting for me and we were due
at the Opera
now I'm no opera buff but the Santa Fe
Opera experience includes an unusual
concept gourmet tailgating we have I
guess it would be a flourless chocolate
torte nice and what are important things
to remember when you're making a dinner
to Bert for some gourmet tailgating at

got to be able to cook it and enjoy it
an hour later and have it not suffer
from the time difference and good
crystal with the Sun going down mom and
I had to eat in a hurry green chile stew
and chiles rellenos $18 from a place
called Dave's not here finally we took
our seats actually we stood $14 tickets
are standing room only
please remember to turn off cell phones
and other electronic devices
the next morning mom and I went shopping
at the international folk art market an
annual gathering of hundreds of
craftspeople from all over the world
there were tinsmiths weavers
skull carvers decorative porta potties

Chinese tapestries we're getting paper

for eventually mom and I found a stall

to buy the man that's over there
very dry skin very
in honor of his hot dry hometown I
